list_definition.mean_english: vạt; miếng (dính vào vật gì để cầm)
list_definition.definition: a small flat piece of some material attached to, or part of, something larger, which stands up so that it can be seen, held, pulled etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You open the packet by pulling the tab.

list_definition.definition: a strip of material attached to a piece of clothing by which it can be hung up

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Hang your jacket up by the tab.

list_definition.definition: a piece of material with a person’s name or some other mark on it, attached to a piece of clothing so that its owner can be identified.
(also tab key, tab stop, or tabulator formal a button on a computer or typewriter keyboard that you use to move to a particular place in a line of a document.
(also tab key, tab stop, or tabulator formal a function in a word-processing program that you use to move to a particular place in a line of a document.

list_ex_of_english: One interpretation is that the output should contain as many tab characters as possible.
To formalise the problem we have to interpret the phrase 'replaces blanks with tabs where possible'.
In the following figures, the two tabs that manage the application can be seen.
By 2004 ravers themselves will be picking up the tab, a development which will surely reduce significantly the already dwindling appeal of the event.
